summary: Adds New NPCs to each faction.
descriptionHtml:
This mod adds new soldiers ingame, from the brutish Imperial Headtaker to the stalwart Stormcloak Shield-Maiden. From the skillful Imperial Praeturion to the sharp-eyed Stormcloak Ranger. These units will appear in random encounters and on the battlefields in game, and sometimes, depending on the die roll within the games leveled lists, you may get a first wave on a fort battle and it will be decimated, and on the second wave they might be able to storm the ramparts.


It can be sorta hard to find the new NPCs so if u find one, snap a picture, and submit it to me on this mod page, and i promise i will add to the mods Pics. Not Compatible with CWO. To make it compatible, you will have to manually create copies of each troop and add each troop to their respective level lists within CWO. But, as far as I know, it is fully compatible with the Open Civil War mod, but make sure to always create a bashed patch with Wrye Bash.

Only download the file you want, do not install two of any of the main files, only one. Any bugs or comments posted where you describe how you installed 2 or more of the main files [u]will be ignored,[/u] as will any future comments or bugs of yours.


It may seem that the Imperials get more troops, but that is the Pro for the Imperials. The Stormcloaks get Strong soldiers, while the Imperials get numbers.

Â Special thanks to BeauMath for helping me figure out something in the mod. Without him, this mod wouldnt have been possible.

Stormcloaks get:
Cubs - Recruits fresh from Basic. Don't expect them to hold up much in a fight.
Field Officers - NCOs who keep the troops informed and moving.
Shield-Maidens - Women who distinguished themselves on the battlefield with bravery equal to their skill and bravado.
Thanes - Stormcloak Nobles who wish to lead from the front rather than behind a map or a desk.
Chieftains - Captains who inspires their men in the heat of battle.
Rangers - Skilled woodsmen who lend their skills to the Stormcloaks as scouts and archers.
Generals - Brave commanders and warriors of the Stormcloaks who lead the armies personally with their swords in their hands.
Elemental Mages and Conjurers - Even though Nords abhor magic, some see its value in war and use it to their advantage.
Archers - Men trained in the use of the bow and arrow.
Wizards - Even though Nords abhor magic, some see its value in war and use it to their advantage.
Vanguards - Heavily armored warriors who lead the charge, pushing through shield walls and even entire Legions to make way for the main force.
Redguard Mercenaries - Redguards contracted from Hammerfell to continue to fight the Legion, who betrayed the honorable desert dwellers.
Beserkers - Blood crazed Nords who know nothing but war and death and use their savagery to tear apart enemies in battle.
War Clerics - Battle-ready priests who rally and heal their comrades in the heat of battle.
Crossbowmen (with the [i]CWExtra Soldiers with Crossbowmen[/i] download) - Men and women trained in the use of the heavy hitting crossbow.

Imperials Get:
Munifexs - Recruits fresh from Basic. Don't expect them to hold up much in a fight.
Optios - High ranking officers who are leading from the front. Inspiring the soldiers with their presence and ending battles with strategic victory.
Centurions - Captains given the task to command the troops and lead them into battle.
Beneficiariis - Orderlies working under the Optios to perform various tasks, in this case, its keeping order amongst the troops in the field and at the front.
Praeturions - Elite soldiers who charge through the enemy lines, slashing and killing all who oppose the Legion.
Thalmor Archers - Elven Archers within the Thalmor tasked with rooting out the Talos worshipers within the Legion.
Thalmor Battlemages - Officers within the Thalmor tasked with rooting out the Talos worshipers within the Legion.
Thalmor Footsoldiers - Elven Footsoldiers within the Thalmor tasked with rooting out the Talos worshipers within the Legion.
Thalmor Knights - Elven nobles within the the Thalmor tasked with rooting out the Talos worshipers within the Legion.
Headtakers - Terrifying, brutish men dressed as headsmen to scare and demoralize the enemy.
Orcish Legionnaires - Orcs who serve the Legion.
Duelists - Skilled individuals who wield dagger and sword fluidly. Each flurry is a dance of death.
Honorguards - Heavy hitting soldiers tasked with protecting the high ranked individuals in the field.
Synod Magisters - Members of the Synod who wish to assist the Imperials in Skyrim.
Whisper Collegiates - Members of the College of Whispers who wish to assist the Imperials in Skyrim.
Generals - Imperial Generals who wish to lead the battles personally rather than from behind a map.
Officers - NCOs and COs tasked with keeping the troops informed and moving.
Archers - Trained men who are experts with the bow.
Wizards - Knowledgeable men who roasts enemies from afar.
Scorpionarius (with the [i]CWExtra Soldiers with Crossbowmen[/i] download) - Individuals trained in the use of the heavy hitting crossbow.
author: kvatchcount
